posts.name: Daniel Marin
posts.cooked: Hi guys, I was wondering if you know of any videos or resources that I can use to learn how to make field geometries. I want to learn how to model my robot and give me an idea of the movement it can have.

posts.name: Pizzatc
posts.cooked: Are you trying to figure out how to simulate your robots movement? Or are to trying to design your robot so that its movement works with the field?

posts.name: Daniel Marin
posts.cooked: Both of them. I’m trying to design a robot that works with the field and also trying to animate the sketch so I can see how it’s it movement.

posts.name: Pizzatc
posts.cooked:
Screenshot 2024-05-28 at 10.06.10 PM 1897×1087 193 KB

Screenshot 2024-05-28 at 10.06.10 PM 1897×1087 193 KB

Screenshot 2024-05-28 at 10.06.10 PM 1897×1087 193 KB

This is a screenshot of our 2023 CAD.

During the beginning of the season one of the first things we do is that is try to rapidly test geometries and figure out which are viable options and which are not.

To do that I draw just lines and circles(blue ones) try to come up with ideas. Usually ill keep it mostly unconstrained and sometimes even undimensioned for awhile.

The reason for this is so that the sketch is very fluid and I can drag lines around and test different set points for example. If an idea has promise ill throw in some more dimensions and constraints and test more configurations.

If we’re happy with the results we start to CAD it further.

Hopefully this answers your question.

posts.name: Daniel Marin
posts.cooked: So it’s basically 2D sketching different ideas and testing them until we get the best one. After that, you start 3D designing all the parts with the measurements you got from the 2D sketch, right?

posts.name: Pizzatc
posts.cooked:
Yep. Usually though a more detailed 2D sketch overlays the geometry. In this case the actual length of our arm tubing wasn’t 37in it was 33in but the geometry sketch gave us where our pivot points should be. Screenshot 2024-05-28 at 10.20.46 PM 1897×1087 281 KB

Screenshot 2024-05-28 at 10.20.46 PM 1897×1087 281 KB

Screenshot 2024-05-28 at 10.20.46 PM 1897×1087 281 KB

posts.name: Daniel Marin
posts.cooked: Do you have like any tips or something that can help me create those drawings? Literally this season my mind was in blank and I struggled doing my intake and shooter 2D sketches.

posts.name: Pizzatc
posts.cooked:
For the geometry sketches. Honestly theres no real way to teach it as a process. My best advice is to gets lots of practice. I swear before the 2023 season I practiced doing this for hours with different past games.

For these part sketches it gets a little tricky and one problem I’ve run into is while I can visualize the parts and where they go not everyone else can like I can so I would get a basic assembly running as soon as possible for review.

posts.name: Daniel Marin
posts.cooked: Thank you so much, I was really over complicating my life trying to animate that 2D sketch and knowing how my robot would interact with the field. Now what i’m going to do is just practice a lot.

posts.name: Pizzatc
posts.cooked: No problem. Just remember its your geometry sketches you want to be able to move not your part sketches. I tried that at some point and well lets just say it didn’t that well for my computer.

posts.name: system
